EVA‐2311          LoRaWAN Temperature PT1000 Round Head Probe Sensor

# NEW Features

- LoRaWAN wireless connectivity
- -70°C to 200°C temperature detection range
- IP67 for PT1000 Round Head Probe Sensor
- Battery life up till 5 years@25°C, 15mins interval setting
- Easy to deploy and maintain

RoHS COMPLIANT 2002/95/EC

# Introduction

EVA-2311 is a LoRaWAN PT1000 round head probe sensor. The extended sensor itself has 2m length cable, IP67 rating design with -70°C to 200°C temperature detection range. It is capable to measure temperature at different kinds of applications, such as refrigerator, freezer, cooling pipe, etc. With its wide range, high penetration rate LoRa connectivity, the data transmission range can be up till hundred or thousand meters away. EVA-2311 can be installed directly on the walls, metal box or poles. EVA-2311 is powered by 2 AA 3.6v Li-ion batteries, battery life can up till 5 years based on certain conditions.

# Common Specification

# Temperature Sensor

| Measurement Range                                        | -70°C to 200°C                                        | | |
| -------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------- |---|---|
| Accuracy (Host and Sensor are in same environment)       | ±0.8°C between 0°C and 55°C                           | | |
| Accuracy (Host and Sensor are in different environments) | ±{(0.15 + 0.002\* |T2|)+1}°C between -70°C and 0°C    |
|                                                          | ±{(0.15 + 0.002\* |T2|)+0.6}°C between 55°C and 200°C |

All product specifications are subject to change without notice. Last updated: 19-Apr-2024

# ±0.5ᵒC Digital Temperature Sensor with Digital Interface

# In a SOP8/MSOP-8 Package

# GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The PJ85775 is a digital temperature sensor with ±0.5 °C accuracy. Temperature data can be read out directly via digital interface (compatible with SMBus, I²C or 2-wire) by MCU, Bluetooth Chip or SoC chip.

# FEATURES

- Operation Voltage: 1.75 V to 5.5 V
- Average Quiescent Current: 3.0 uA (Typ.) at 1.0 con/s
- Standby Current: 1.0 uA (Typ.)
- Temperature Accuracy without calibration:
- ±0.5 °C from 0 °C to 50 °C
- ±1.0 °C from -20 °C to 85 °C
- ±1.5 °C from -40 °C to 125 °C
- 12 bit ADC for 0.0625 °C resolution
- Compatible with SMBus, 2-wire and I²C interface
- Compatible industry LM75 with performance improved
- Programmable Over/Under Temperature
- Programmable Active Low or High for ALERT pin
- Support SMBus ALERT Response Address (ARA)
- Generate 32 different slave address by setup A0, A1, A2 pin
- Temperature Range: -40 °C to 125 °C

# APPLICATIONS

# Temperature Sensor

| Measurement Range                                        | -70°C to 200°C                                        | | |
| -------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------- |---|---|
| Accuracy (Host and Sensor are in same environment)       | ±0.8°C between 0°C and 55°C                           | | |
| Accuracy (Host and Sensor are in different environments) | ±{(0.15 + 0.002\* |T2|)+1}°C between -70°C and 0°C    |
|                                                          | ±{(0.15 + 0.002\* |T2|)+0.6}°C between 55°C and 200°C |

All product specifications are subject to change without notice. Last updated: 19-Apr-2024

The measuring point for the nominal resistance is 2 mm from the end of the sensor body.

# Temperature Range of Tolerance Class

Validity of Class F 0.3 (B) -50 °C to +150 °C

The specified tolerance classes refer to continuous operation.

Short term temperature exposure for soldering: Max. 5 minutes up to 250 °C.

| L:  | 2.1 -0.2/+0.2  |
| --- | -------------- |

| Lø: | 0.22 ±0.02     |
| W2: | 0.7 ±0.1       |

Air (v = 3 m/s): t0.5 = 1.5 s

t0.9 = 5 s

Pt100 Ω: 0.3 to 1 mA

EVA‐2311          LoRaWAN Temperature PT1000 Round Head Probe Sensor

# NEW Features

- LoRaWAN wireless connectivity
- -70°C to 200°C temperature detection range
- IP67 for PT1000 Round Head Probe Sensor
- Battery life up till 5 years@25°C, 15mins interval setting
- Easy to deploy and maintain

RoHS COMPLIANT 2002/95/EC

# Introduction

EVA-2311 is a LoRaWAN PT1000 round head probe sensor. The extended sensor itself has 2m length cable, IP67 rating design with -70°C to 200°C temperature detection range. It is capable to measure temperature at different kinds of applications, such as refrigerator, freezer, cooling pipe, etc. With its wide range, high penetration rate LoRa connectivity, the data transmission range can be up till hundred or thousand meters away. EVA-2311 can be installed directly on the walls, metal box or poles. EVA-2311 is powered by 2 AA 3.6v Li-ion batteries, battery life can up till 5 years based on certain conditions.

# Common Specification

PJ85775
# ±0.5ᵒC Digital Temperature Sensor with Digital Interface

# In a SOP8/MSOP-8 Package

# GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The PJ85775 is a digital temperature sensor with ±0.5 °C accuracy. Temperature data can be read out directly via digital interface (compatible with SMBus, I²C or 2-wire) by MCU, Bluetooth Chip or SoC chip.

# FEATURES

- Operation Voltage: 1.75 V to 5.5 V
- Average Quiescent Current: 3.0 uA (Typ.) at 1.0 con/s
- Standby Current: 1.0 uA (Typ.)
- Temperature Accuracy without calibration:
- ±0.5 °C from 0 °C to 50 °C
- ±1.0 °C from -20 °C to 85 °C
- ±1.5 °C from -40 °C to 125 °C
- 12 bit ADC for 0.0625 °C resolution
- Compatible with SMBus, 2-wire and I²C interface
- Compatible industry LM75 with performance improved
- Programmable Over/Under Temperature
- Programmable Active Low or High for ALERT pin
- Support SMBus ALERT Response Address (ARA)
- Generate 32 different slave address by setup A0, A1, A2 pin
- Temperature Range: -40 °C to 125 °C

# APPLICATIONS

PJ85775
# ±0.5ᵒC Digital Temperature Sensor with Digital Interface

# In a SOP8/MSOP-8 Package

# GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The PJ85775 is a digital temperature sensor with ±0.5 °C accuracy. Temperature data can be read out directly via digital interface (compatible with SMBus, I²C or 2-wire) by MCU, Bluetooth Chip or SoC chip.

# FEATURES

- Operation Voltage: 1.75 V to 5.5 V
- Average Quiescent Current: 3.0 uA (Typ.) at 1.0 con/s
- Standby Current: 1.0 uA (Typ.)
- Temperature Accuracy without calibration:
- ±0.5 °C from 0 °C to 50 °C
- ±1.0 °C from -20 °C to 85 °C
- ±1.5 °C from -40 °C to 125 °C
- 12 bit ADC for 0.0625 °C resolution
- Compatible with SMBus, 2-wire and I²C interface
- Compatible industry LM75 with performance improved
- Programmable Over/Under Temperature
- Programmable Active Low or High for ALERT pin
- Support SMBus ALERT Response Address (ARA)
- Generate 32 different slave address by setup A0, A1, A2 pin
- Temperature Range: -40 °C to 125 °C

# APPLICATIONS

# Configuration Instructions

# SNAP SIGNAL Configuration Software

Banner's SNAP SIGNAL Configuration Software offers an easy way to configure and demonstrate Banner Modbus devices. Users have full control of device configuration, the ability to visualize device data, and to demonstrate device features. The easy-to-use software provides a variety of tools and works with Banner Modbus devices.

- Allows for the configuration and demo of Banner Modbus devices
- Free to download and available on the Banner website at https://www.bannerengineering.com/sg/en/products/software/snap-signal-configuration-software.html
- Works on Microsoft® Windows® 7 and 10(1)
- BWA-UCT-900 cable required to connect PC-based SNAP SIGNAL Configuration Software to Banner Modbus devices

PJ85775
# ±0.5ᵒC Digital Temperature Sensor with Digital Interface

# In a SOP8/MSOP-8 Package

# GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The PJ85775 is a digital temperature sensor with ±0.5 °C accuracy. Temperature data can be read out directly via digital interface (compatible with SMBus, I²C or 2-wire) by MCU, Bluetooth Chip or SoC chip.

# FEATURES

- Operation Voltage: 1.75 V to 5.5 V
- Average Quiescent Current: 3.0 uA (Typ.) at 1.0 con/s
- Standby Current: 1.0 uA (Typ.)
- Temperature Accuracy without calibration:
- ±0.5 °C from 0 °C to 50 °C
- ±1.0 °C from -20 °C to 85 °C
- ±1.5 °C from -40 °C to 125 °C
- 12 bit ADC for 0.0625 °C resolution
- Compatible with SMBus, 2-wire and I²C interface
- Compatible industry LM75 with performance improved
- Programmable Over/Under Temperature
- Programmable Active Low or High for ALERT pin
- Support SMBus ALERT Response Address (ARA)
- Generate 32 different slave address by setup A0, A1, A2 pin
- Temperature Range: -40 °C to 125 °C

# APPLICATIONS

detailed_results.question: What are some of the key outputs provided by the BSEC software for the BME690?
detailed_results.generated_answer:
The BSEC (Bosch Software Environmental Cluster) software for the BME690 sensor provides several key outputs, including:

1. **Temperature**: The software calculates and outputs the temperature readings from the sensor.
2. **Humidity**: It provides relative humidity measurements.
3. **Pressure**: The software outputs atmospheric pressure readings.
4. **Gas Resistance**: It measures and outputs the resistance of the gas sensor, which can be used to infer air quality.
5. **IAQ (Indoor Air Quality) Index**: The software can calculate an IAQ index based on the sensor data, providing an overall assessment of air quality.
6. **Dew Point**: It calculates the dew point temperature based on humidity and temperature readings.

These outputs are essential for applications in smart HVAC systems, portable devices, and thermal management, allowing for effective monitoring and control of environmental conditions.
detailed_results.ground_truth: Key outputs of the BSEC software for the BME690 include Index for Air Quality (IAQ), CO2 equivalent (ppm), and b-VOC equivalent (ppm).
detailed_results.expected_response: The BSEC software for the BME690 provides several key outputs, including an Index for Air Quality (IAQ), bVOC-equivalents (ppm), CO2-equivalents (ppm), Gas scan result (%), and an Intensity level.
detailed_results.expected_contexts: Excerpt 1 : Key parameters for gas sensor: Output data processing: Major direct outputs: Index for Air Quality (IAQ), bVOC- & CO2-equivalents (ppm), Gas scan result (%) & Intensity level, Excerpt 2 : The BSEC provides numerous useful outputs (see Table 20), e.g. an Index for Air Quality (IAQ), bVOC- & CO2-equivalents (ppm) and Gas scan results (%)., Excerpt 3 : BSEC outputs: IAQ (0-500), Static IAQ, CO2 equivalent (ppm), b-VOC equivalent (ppm), TVOC equivalent (ppb)., Excerpt 4 : The IAQ output is an index that can have values between 0 and 500., Excerpt 5 : The BME AI-Studio tool enables customers to train the BME690 gas scanner on their specific application.

# SNAP SIGNAL Configuration Software

Banner's SNAP SIGNAL Configuration Software offers an easy way to configure and demonstrate Banner Modbus devices. Users have full control of device configuration, the ability to visualize device data, and to demonstrate device features. The easy-to-use software provides a variety of tools and works with Banner Modbus devices.

- Allows for the configuration and demo of Banner Modbus devices
- Free to download and available on the Banner website at https://www.bannerengineering.com/sg/en/products/software/snap-signal-configuration-software.html
- Works on Microsoft® Windows® 7 and 10(1)
- BWA-UCT-900 cable required to connect PC-based SNAP SIGNAL Configuration Software to Banner Modbus devices

EVA‐2311          LoRaWAN Temperature PT1000 Round Head Probe Sensor

# NEW Features

- LoRaWAN wireless connectivity
- -70°C to 200°C temperature detection range
- IP67 for PT1000 Round Head Probe Sensor
- Battery life up till 5 years@25°C, 15mins interval setting
- Easy to deploy and maintain

RoHS COMPLIANT 2002/95/EC

# Introduction

EVA-2311 is a LoRaWAN PT1000 round head probe sensor. The extended sensor itself has 2m length cable, IP67 rating design with -70°C to 200°C temperature detection range. It is capable to measure temperature at different kinds of applications, such as refrigerator, freezer, cooling pipe, etc. With its wide range, high penetration rate LoRa connectivity, the data transmission range can be up till hundred or thousand meters away. EVA-2311 can be installed directly on the walls, metal box or poles. EVA-2311 is powered by 2 AA 3.6v Li-ion batteries, battery life can up till 5 years based on certain conditions.

PJ85775
# ±0.5ᵒC Digital Temperature Sensor with Digital Interface

# In a SOP8/MSOP-8 Package

# GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The PJ85775 is a digital temperature sensor with ±0.5 °C accuracy. Temperature data can be read out directly via digital interface (compatible with SMBus, I²C or 2-wire) by MCU, Bluetooth Chip or SoC chip.

# FEATURES

- Operation Voltage: 1.75 V to 5.5 V
- Average Quiescent Current: 3.0 uA (Typ.) at 1.0 con/s
- Standby Current: 1.0 uA (Typ.)
- Temperature Accuracy without calibration:
- ±0.5 °C from 0 °C to 50 °C
- ±1.0 °C from -20 °C to 85 °C
- ±1.5 °C from -40 °C to 125 °C
- 12 bit ADC for 0.0625 °C resolution
- Compatible with SMBus, 2-wire and I²C interface
- Compatible industry LM75 with performance improved
- Programmable Over/Under Temperature
- Programmable Active Low or High for ALERT pin
- Support SMBus ALERT Response Address (ARA)
- Generate 32 different slave address by setup A0, A1, A2 pin
- Temperature Range: -40 °C to 125 °C

# APPLICATIONS

- Smart HVAC Systems

- Thermal Management

For the YAGEO LS219, typical applications include:

detailed_results.question: Does the YAGEO LS219 support the I2C interface like the PANJIT PJ85775 does?
detailed_results.generated_answer: No, the YAGEO LS219 does not support the I2C interface. The YAGEO LS219 is a Pt temperature sensor designed for low temperature applications and does not mention compatibility with digital interfaces like I2C. detailed_results.ground_truth: No, the YAGEO LS219 does not support I2C; it provides analog resistance output via leads. The PANJIT PJ85775 does support I2C.

- IP67 for PT1000 Round Head Probe Sensor
- Battery life up till 5 years@25°C, 15mins interval setting

RoHS COMPLIANT 2002/95/EC

# Introduction

EVA-2311 is a LoRaWAN PT1000 round head probe sensor. The extended sensor itself has 2m length cable, IP67 rating design with -70°C to 200°C temperature detection range. It is capable to measure temperature at different kinds of applications, such as refrigerator, freezer, cooling pipe, etc. With its wide range, high penetration rate LoRa connectivity, the data transmission range can be up till hundred or thousand meters away. EVA-2311 can be installed directly on the walls, metal box or poles. EVA-2311 is powered by 2 AA 3.6v Li-ion batteries, battery life can up till 5 years based on certain conditions.

detailed_results.question: For monitoring a high-humidity industrial environment with potential water spray, which sensor would be most suitable based on the datasheets?
detailed_results.generated_answer:
Based on the provided datasheets, the **S15S Temperature and Humidity Sensor** would be the most suitable choice for monitoring a high-humidity industrial environment with potential water spray. 

Here are the reasons for this selection:

1. **Rugged Design**: The S15S sensor features a rugged overmolded design, which is likely to provide better protection against moisture and physical damage compared to other sensors.

2. **Filter Cap Options**: It ships with an aluminum grill filter cap and offers an optional stainless steel 10 μm sintered filter, which can help protect the sensor from water spray and contaminants.

3. **Modbus Connectivity**: The sensor connects via RS485 Modbus® registers, making it suitable for industrial applications where robust communication protocols are required.

4. **Humidity Measurement**: The S15S is specifically designed to measure humidity, which is crucial in high-humidity environments.

In contrast, the BME690 sensor, while capable of measuring temperature, humidity, pressure, and gas, does not specify its ruggedness or protection against water spray, making it less ideal for this specific application.
detailed_results.ground_truth: The Banner S15S is most suitable for a high-humidity industrial environment due to its high IP ratings (IP65/67/68) and rugged design.
detailed_results.expected_response: The Banner S15S would be the most suitable choice, as it offers IP65, IP67, and IP68 ratings, indicating it is well-protected against dust and water, and it is designed with a rugged overmolded body suitable for industrial settings.
detailed_results.expected_contexts: Excerpt 1 : S15S Environmental Rating at M12 Connection: IP65, IP67, IP68, Excerpt 2 : S15S Features: Rugged overmolded design, Excerpt 3 : EVA-2311 probe has an IP67 rating, but the main body is only IP30., Excerpt 4 : BME690 can be used in high condensation applications, but no specific IP rating is given., Excerpt 5 : LS219 is designed for HVAC and industrial equipment, but is an unhoused component sensor.

detailed_results.question: Compare the power sources for the Advantech EVA-2311 and the Bosch BME690.
detailed_results.generated_answer:
The power sources for the Advantech EVA-2311 and the Bosch BME690 differ in their specifications:

1. **Advantech EVA-2311**:
   - The EVA-2311 is powered by 2 AA 3.6V Li-ion batteries. 
   - It has a battery life of up to 5 years when operating at a temperature of 25°C with a 15-minute interval setting.

2. **Bosch BME690**:
   - The power source details for the Bosch BME690 are not explicitly mentioned in the provided excerpt. However, it is described as a "digital low power" sensor, which typically implies that it is designed to operate efficiently with minimal power consumption, possibly using a low-voltage power supply or battery.

In summary, the EVA-2311 uses specific AA Li-ion batteries with a defined battery life, while the BME690's power source details are not provided but suggest a low power consumption design.
detailed_results.ground_truth: The EVA-2311 uses two 3.6V AA batteries, while the BME690 requires separate VDD (1.71-3.6V) and VDDIO (1.2-3.6V) power supplies.
detailed_results.expected_response: The Advantech EVA-2311 is powered by two 3.6V AA Li-ion batteries. The Bosch BME690 requires a VDD main supply voltage from 1.71V to 3.6V and a separate VDDIO interface voltage from 1.2V to 3.6V.

# ±0.5ᵒC Digital Temperature Sensor with Digital Interface

# In a SOP8/MSOP-8 Package

# GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The PJ85775 is a digital temperature sensor with ±0.5 °C accuracy. Temperature data can be read out directly via digital interface (compatible with SMBus, I²C or 2-wire) by MCU, Bluetooth Chip or SoC chip.

- Operation Voltage: 1.75 V to 5.5 V
- Average Quiescent Current: 3.0 uA (Typ.) at 1.0 con/s
- Standby Current: 1.0 uA (Typ.)

- ±0.5 °C from 0 °C to 50 °C
- ±1.0 °C from -20 °C to 85 °C
- ±1.5 °C from -40 °C to 125 °C
- 12 bit ADC for 0.0625 °C resolution
- Compatible with SMBus, 2-wire and I²C interface
- Compatible industry LM75 with performance improved
- Programmable Over/Under Temperature
- Programmable Active Low or High for ALERT pin
- Support SMBus ALERT Response Address (ARA)
- Generate 32 different slave address by setup A0, A1, A2 pin
- Temperature Range: -40 °C to 125 °C

# APPLICATIONS

detailed_results.question: Contrast the physical packages of the PANJIT PJ85775 and the Bosch BME690.
detailed_results.generated_answer:
The PANJIT PJ85775 is available in SOP8 and MSOP-8 packages, which are both surface-mount packages commonly used for integrated circuits. These packages are relatively compact and suitable for applications where space is a concern.

On the other hand, the Bosch BME690 does not specify a physical package type in the provided excerpt. However, it is a digital low-power sensor that typically would be designed for integration into various electronic devices, potentially in a compact form factor as well.

In summary, while the PJ85775 explicitly mentions its SOP8 and MSOP-8 package options, the BME690's package details are not provided, making it difficult to directly compare their physical packages. The PJ85775 is clearly defined in terms of package type, while the BME690's packaging information is absent.
detailed_results.ground_truth: The PJ85775 comes in leaded SOP-8/MSOP-8 packages, while the BME690 uses a leadless metal lid LGA package.
detailed_results.expected_response: The PANJIT PJ85775 is available in SOP-8 and MSOP-8 plastic packages with leads. The Bosch BME690 comes in a 3.0 x 3.0 x 0.9 mm³ metal lid LGA (Land Grid Array) package, which is a leadless surface-mount package.

PJ85775
# ±0.5ᵒC Digital Temperature Sensor with Digital Interface

# In a SOP8/MSOP-8 Package

# GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The PJ85775 is a digital temperature sensor with ±0.5 °C accuracy. Temperature data can be read out directly via digital interface (compatible with SMBus, I²C or 2-wire) by MCU, Bluetooth Chip or SoC chip.

# FEATURES

- Operation Voltage: 1.75 V to 5.5 V
- Average Quiescent Current: 3.0 uA (Typ.) at 1.0 con/s
- Standby Current: 1.0 uA (Typ.)
- Temperature Accuracy without calibration:
- ±0.5 °C from 0 °C to 50 °C
- ±1.0 °C from -20 °C to 85 °C
- ±1.5 °C from -40 °C to 125 °C
- 12 bit ADC for 0.0625 °C resolution
- Compatible with SMBus, 2-wire and I²C interface
- Compatible industry LM75 with performance improved
- Programmable Over/Under Temperature
- Programmable Active Low or High for ALERT pin
- Support SMBus ALERT Response Address (ARA)
- Generate 32 different slave address by setup A0, A1, A2 pin
- Temperature Range: -40 °C to 125 °C

# APPLICATIONS

EVA‐2311          LoRaWAN Temperature PT1000 Round Head Probe Sensor

# NEW Features

- LoRaWAN wireless connectivity
- -70°C to 200°C temperature detection range
- IP67 for PT1000 Round Head Probe Sensor
- Battery life up till 5 years@25°C, 15mins interval setting
- Easy to deploy and maintain

RoHS COMPLIANT 2002/95/EC

# Introduction

EVA-2311 is a LoRaWAN PT1000 round head probe sensor. The extended sensor itself has 2m length cable, IP67 rating design with -70°C to 200°C temperature detection range. It is capable to measure temperature at different kinds of applications, such as refrigerator, freezer, cooling pipe, etc. With its wide range, high penetration rate LoRa connectivity, the data transmission range can be up till hundred or thousand meters away. EVA-2311 can be installed directly on the walls, metal box or poles. EVA-2311 is powered by 2 AA 3.6v Li-ion batteries, battery life can up till 5 years based on certain conditions.

detailed_results.question: Which of these sensors utilize a wireless communication protocol and what are those protocols?
detailed_results.generated_answer:
The sensors that utilize a wireless communication protocol are:

1. **S15S Temperature and Humidity Sensor** - This sensor connects via RS485 Modbus® registers, which is a wired communication protocol, not wireless.

2. **LoRaWAN Temperature and Humidity Sensor (EVA-2311 series)** - These sensors utilize the LoRaWAN wireless communication protocol, with specific frequency bands for different regions:
   - EVA-2311-NA: US 902-928 MHz
   - EVA-2311-EA: EU 863-870 MHz
   - EVA-2311-TA: AS 919-924 MHz
   - EVA-2311-ZA: AU 915-928 MHz

3. **LoRaWAN Gateway (WISE-6610 series)** - This device supports LoRaWAN communication, operating on various frequency bands depending on the model.

In summary, the LoRaWAN Temperature and Humidity Sensors and the LoRaWAN Gateway utilize the LoRaWAN wireless communication protocol.
detailed_results.ground_truth: The Advantech EVA-2311 uses the LoRaWAN wireless protocol.
detailed_results.expected_response: The Advantech EVA-2311 is the only sensor listed that uses a wireless communication protocol, which is LoRaWAN.
detailed_results.expected_contexts: Excerpt 1 : EVA-2311 Features: LoRaWAN wireless connectivity, Excerpt 2 : S15S connects via RS485 Modbus., Excerpt 3 : PJ85775 and BME690 use wired interfaces like I2C and SPI., Excerpt 4 : LS219 is a resistive sensor with direct wire leads., Excerpt 5 : EVA-2311 Wireless Communication Topology: Star (LoRa/LoRaWAN)

detailed_results.question: For a long-term, low-power, battery-operated deployment, which would be a better choice between the BME690 and the EVA-2311?
detailed_results.generated_answer:
For a long-term, low-power, battery-operated deployment, the EVA-2311 would be the better choice. Here are the reasons:

1. **Battery Life**: The EVA-2311 has a battery life of up to 5 years at a 15-minute interval setting, which is ideal for long-term deployments. In contrast, the BME690's battery life is not specified in the provided information, making it difficult to assess its suitability for long-term use.

2. **LoRaWAN Connectivity**: The EVA-2311 utilizes LoRaWAN technology, which is designed for low-power, long-range communication. This is particularly beneficial for applications where sensors are deployed in remote locations.

3. **Temperature Range**: The EVA-2311 has a wide temperature detection range of -70°C to 200°C, making it suitable for various applications, including extreme environments.

4. **IP67 Rating**: The EVA-2311 is rated IP67, indicating it is dust-tight and can withstand immersion in water, which is advantageous for outdoor or harsh environments.

While the BME690 is a digital sensor that measures temperature, humidity, pressure, and gas with AI capabilities, it may not be specifically optimized for long-term battery-operated deployments without additional information on its power consumption and battery life. Therefore, for your requirements, the EVA-2311 is the more suitable option.
detailed_results.ground_truth: The Advantech EVA-2311 is better for long-term battery deployment as it's a complete product with a 5-year battery life specification.
detailed_results.expected_response: The Advantech EVA-2311 is a better choice for a long-term, low-power deployment as it is a complete, self-contained unit with a specified battery life of up to 5 years. The BME690 is a component sensor that requires integration, and its power consumption, while low in ULP mode (50 µA), depends heavily on the specific use case and implementation.

EVA‐2311          LoRaWAN Temperature PT1000 Round Head Probe Sensor

# NEW Features

- LoRaWAN wireless connectivity
- -70°C to 200°C temperature detection range
- IP67 for PT1000 Round Head Probe Sensor
- Battery life up till 5 years@25°C, 15mins interval setting
- Easy to deploy and maintain

RoHS COMPLIANT 2002/95/EC

# Introduction

EVA-2311 is a LoRaWAN PT1000 round head probe sensor. The extended sensor itself has 2m length cable, IP67 rating design with -70°C to 200°C temperature detection range. It is capable to measure temperature at different kinds of applications, such as refrigerator, freezer, cooling pipe, etc. With its wide range, high penetration rate LoRa connectivity, the data transmission range can be up till hundred or thousand meters away. EVA-2311 can be installed directly on the walls, metal box or poles. EVA-2311 is powered by 2 AA 3.6v Li-ion batteries, battery life can up till 5 years based on certain conditions.
